books.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles

chapters.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:1
verses.text: The Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:2
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:3
verses.text: Let a bishop be ordained by two or three bishops.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:4
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:5
verses.text: Let a presbyter, deacon, and the rest of the clergy, be ordained by one bishop,  Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:6
verses.text: (III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:7
verses.text: and IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:8
verses.text: )  If any bishop or presbyter offer any other things at the altar, besides that which the Lord ordained for the sacrifice, as honey, or milk, or strong-made drink instead of wine, or birds, or any living things, or vegetables, besides that which is ordained, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:9
verses.text: Excepting only new ears of corn, and grapes at the suitable season.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:10
verses.text: Neither is it allowed to bring anything else to the altar at the time of the holy oblation, excepting oil for the lamps, and incense.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:11
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:12
Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:13
verses.text: )  Let all other fruits be sent home as first-fruits for the bishops and presbyters, but not offered at the altar.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:14
verses.text: But the bishops and presbyters should of course give a share of these things to the deacons, and the rest of the clergy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:15
verses.text: Canon V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:16
verses.text: (VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:17
verses.text: )  Let not a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, put away his wife under pretence of religion; but if he put her away, let him be excommunicated; and if he persists, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:18
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:19
verses.text: (VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:20
verses.text: )  Let not a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, undertake worldly business; otherwise let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:21
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:22
verses.text: (VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:23
verses.text: )  If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, shall celebrate the holy day of Easter before the vernal equinox, with the Jews, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:24
verses.text: Canon VIII (IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:25
verses.text: )  If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any one on the sacerdotal list, when the offering is made, does not partake of it, let him declare the cause; and if it be a reasonable one, let him be excused; but if he does not declare it, let him be excommunicated, as being a cause of offence to the people, and occasioning a suspicion against the offerer, as if he had not made the offering properly.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:26
verses.text: Canon IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:27
Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:28
verses.text: )  All the faithful who come in and hear the Scriptures, but do not stay for the prayers and the Holy Communion, are to be excommunicated, as causing disorder in the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:29
verses.text: Canon X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:30
verses.text: (XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:31
verses.text: )  If any one shall pray, even in a private house, with an excommunicated person, let him also be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:32
verses.text: Canon XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:33
verses.text: (XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:34
verses.text: )  If any clergyman shall join in prayer with a deposed clergyman, as if he were a clergyman, let him also be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:35
verses.text: Canon XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:36
verses.text: and XIII (XIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:37
verses.text: )  If any one of the clergy or laity who is excommunicated, or not to be received, shall go away, and be received in another city without commendatory letters, let both the receiver and the received be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:38
verses.text: But if he be excommunicated already, let the time of his excommunication be lengthened.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:39
verses.text: Canon XIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:40
verses.text: A bishop is not to be allowed to leave his own parish, and pass over into another, although he may be pressed by many to do so, unless there be some proper cause constraining him, as if he can confer some greater benefit upon the persons of that place in the word of godliness.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:41
verses.text: And this must be done not of his own accord, but by the judgment of many bishops, and at their earnest exhortation.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:42
verses.text: Canon XV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:43
verses.text: If any presbyter, or deacon, or any other of the list of the clergy, shall leave his own parish, and go into another, and having entirely forsaken his own, shall make his abode in the other parish without the permission of his own bishop, we ordain that he shall no longer perform divine service; more especially if his own bishop having exhorted him to return he has refused to do so, and persists in his disorderly conduct.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:44
verses.text: But let him communicate there as a layman.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:45
verses.text: Canon XVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:46
verses.text: If, however, the bishop, with whom any such persons are staying, shall disregard the command that they are to cease from performing divine offices, and shall receive them as clergymen, let him be excommunicated, as a teacher of disorder.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:47
verses.text: Canon XVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:48
verses.text: He who has been twice married after baptism, or who has had a concubine, cannot become a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any other of the sacerdotal list.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:49
verses.text: Canon XVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:50
verses.text: He who married a widow, or a divorced woman, or an harlot, or a servant-maid, or an actress, cannot be a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any other of the sacerdotal list.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:51
verses.text: Canon XIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:52
verses.text: He who has married two sisters, or a niece, cannot become a clergyman.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:53
verses.text: Canon XX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:54
verses.text: If a clergyman becomes surety for any one, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:55
verses.text: Canon XXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:56
verses.text: An eunuch, if he has been made so by the violence of men or [if his virilia have been amputated] in times of persecution, or if he has been born so, if in other respects he is worthy, may be made a bishop.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:57
verses.text: Canon XXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:58
verses.text: He who has mutilated himself, cannot become a clergyman, for he is a self-murderer, and an enemy to the workmanship of God.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:59
verses.text: Canon XXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:60
verses.text: If any man being a clergyman shall mutilate himself, let him be deposed, for he is a self-murderer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:61
verses.text: Canon XXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:62
verses.text: If a layman mutilate himself, let him be excommunicated for three years, as practising against his own life.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:63
verses.text: Canon XXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:64
verses.text: (XXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:65
verses.text: and XXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:66
verses.text: )  If a bishop, presbyter, or deacon be found guilty of fornication, perjury, or theft, let him be deposed, but let him not be excommunicated; for the Scripture says, "thou shalt not punish a man twice for the same offence".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:67
verses.text: In like manner the other clergy shall be subject to the same proceeding.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:68
verses.text: Canon XXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:69
verses.text: (XXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:70
verses.text: )  Of those who have been admitted to the clergy unmarried, we ordain, that the readers and singers only may, if they will, marry.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:71
verses.text: Canon XXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:72
verses.text: (XXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:73
verses.text: )  If a bishop, presbyter, or deacon shall strike any of the faithful who have sinned, or of the unbelievers who have done wrong, with the intention of frightening them, we command that he be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:74
verses.text: For our Lord has by no means taught us to do so, but, on the contrary, when he was smitten he smote not again, when he was reviled he reviled not again, when he suffered he threatened not.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:75
verses.text: Canon XXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:76
verses.text: (XXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:77
verses.text: )  If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, having been justly deposed upon open accusations, shall dare to meddle with any of the divine offices which had been intrusted to him, let him be altogether cut off from the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:78
verses.text: Canon XXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:79
verses.text: (XXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:80
verses.text: )  If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, shall obtain possession of that dignity by money, let both him and the person who ordained him be deposed, and also altogether cut off from all communion, as Simon Magus was by me Peter.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:81
verses.text: Canon XXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:82
verses.text: (XXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:83
verses.text: )  If any bishop obtain possession of a church by the aid of the temporal powers, let him be deposed and excommunicated, and all who communicate with him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:84
verses.text: Canon XXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:85
verses.text: (XXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:86
verses.text: )  If any presbyter, despising his own bishop, shall collect a separate congregation, and erect another altar, not having any grounds for condemning the bishop with regard to religion or justice, let him be deposed for his ambition; for he is a tyrant; in like manner also the rest of the clergy, and as many as join him; and let laymen be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:87
verses.text: Let this, however, be done after a first, second, and third admonition from the bishop.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:88
verses.text: Canon XXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:89
verses.text: (XXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:90
verses.text: )  If any presbyter or deacon has been excommunicated by a bishop, he may not be received into communion again by any other than by him who excommunicated him, unless it happen that the bishop who excommunicated him be dead.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:91
verses.text: Canon XXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:92
verses.text: (XXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:93
verses.text: )  No foreign bishop, presbyter, or deacon, may be received without commendatory letters; and when they are produced let the persons be examined; and if they be preachers of godliness, let them be received.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:94
verses.text: Otherwise, although you supply them with what they need, you must not receive them into communion, for many things are done surreptitiously.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:95
verses.text: Canon XXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:96
verses.text: (XXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:97
verses.text: )  The bishops of every nation must acknowledge him who is first among them and account him as their head, and do nothing of consequence without his consent; but each may do those things only which concern his own parish, and the country places which belong to it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:98
verses.text: But neither let him (who is the first) do anything without the consent of all; for so there will be unanimity, and God will be glorified through the Lord in the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:99
verses.text: Canon XXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:100
verses.text: (XXXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:101
verses.text: )  Let not a bishop dare to ordain beyond his own limits, in cities and places not subject to him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:102
verses.text: But if he be convicted of doing so, without the consent of those persons who have authority over such cities and places, let him be deposed, and those also whom he has ordained.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:103
verses.text: Canon XXXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:104
verses.text: (XXXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:105
verses.text: )  If any person, having been ordained bishop, does not undertake the ministry, and the care of the people committed to him, let him be excommunicated until he does undertake it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:106
verses.text: In like manner a presbyter or deacon.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:107
verses.text: But if he has gone and has not been received, not of his own will but from the perverseness of the people, let him continue bishop; and let the clergy of the city be excommunicated, because they have not corrected the disobedient people.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:108
verses.text: Canon XXXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:109
verses.text: (XXXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:110
verses.text: )  Let there be a meeting of the bishops twice a year, and let them examine amongst themselves the decrees concerning religion and settle the ecclesiastical controversies which may have occurred.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:111
verses.text: One meeting to be held in the fourth week of Pentecost [i-e:, the fourth week after Easter], and the other on the 12th day of the month Hyperberetaeus [i-e:, October].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:112
verses.text: Canon XXXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:113
verses.text: (XXXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:114
verses.text: )  Let the bishop have the care of all the goods of the Church, and let him administer them as under the inspection of God.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:115
verses.text: But he must not alienate any of them or give the things which belong to God to his own relations.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:116
verses.text: If they be poor let him relieve them as poor; but let him not, under that pretence, sell the goods of the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:117
verses.text: Canon XXXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:118
verses.text: (XL.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:119
verses.text: )  Let not the presbyters or deacons do anything without the sanction of the bishop; for he it is who is intrusted with the people of the Lord, and of whom will be required the account of their souls.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:120
verses.text: Canon XL.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:121
verses.text: (XL.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:122
verses.text: Continued.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:123
verses.text: )  Let the private goods of the bishop, if he have any such, and those of the Lord, be clearly distinguished, that the bishop may have the power of leaving his own goods, when he dies, to whom he will, and how he will, and that the bishop's own property may not be lost under pretence of its being the property of the Church: for it may be that he has a wife, or children, or relations, or servants; and it is just before God and man, that neither should the Church suffer any loss through ignorance of the bishop's own property, nor the bishop or his relations be injured under pretext of the Church: nor that those who belong to him should be involved in contests, and cast reproaches upon his death.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:124
verses.text: Canon XLI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:125
verses.text: We ordain that the bishop have authority over the goods of the Church: for if he is to be intrusted with the precious souls of men, much more are temporal possessions to be intrusted to him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:126
verses.text: He is therefore to administer them all of his own authority, and supply those who need, through the presbyters and deacons, in the fear of God, and with all reverence.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:127
verses.text: He may also, if need be, take what is required for his own necessary wants, and for the brethren to whom he has to show hospitality, so that he may not be in any want.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:128
verses.text: For the law of God has ordained, that they who wait at the altar should be nourished of the altar.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:129
verses.text: Neither does any soldier bear arms against an enemy at his own cost.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:130
verses.text: Canon XLII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:131
verses.text: If a bishop or presbyter, or deacon, is addicted to dice or drinking, let him either give it over, or be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:132
verses.text: Canon XLIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:133
verses.text: If a subdeacon, reader, or singer, commits the same things, let him either give over, or be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:134
verses.text: So also laymen.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:135
verses.text: Canon XLIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:136
verses.text: Let a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, who takes usury from those who borrow of him, give up doing so, or be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:137
verses.text: Canon XLV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:138
verses.text: Let a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, who has only prayed with heretics, be excommunicated: but if he has permitted them to perform any clerical office, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:139
verses.text: Canon XLVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:140
verses.text: We ordain that a bishop, or presbyter, who has admitted the baptism or sacrifice of heretics, be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:141
verses.text: For what concord hath Christ with Belial, or what part hath a believer with an infidel?  Canon XLVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:142
verses.text: Let a bishop or presbyter who shall baptize again one who has rightly received baptism, or who shall not baptize one who has been polluted by the ungodly, be deposed, as despising the cross and death of the Lord, and not making a distinction between the true priests and the false.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:143
verses.text: Canon XLVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:144
verses.text: If any layman put away his wife and marry another, or one who has been divorced by another man, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:145
verses.text: Canon XLIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:146
verses.text: If any bishop or presbyter, contrary to the ordinance of the Lord, does not baptize into the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost, but into three Unoriginated Beings, or three Sons, or three Comforters, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:147
verses.text: Canon L.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:148
verses.text: If any bishop or presbyter does not perform the one initiation with three immersions, but with giving one immersion only, into the death of the Lord, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:149
verses.text: For the Lord said not, Baptize into my death, but, "Go, make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:150
verses.text: Canon LI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:151
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any one of the sacerdotal list, abstains from marriage, or flesh, or wine, not by way of religious restraint, but as abhorring them, forgetting that God made all things very good, and that he made man male and female, and blaspheming the work of creation, let him be corrected, or else be deposed, and cast out of the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:152
verses.text: In like manner a layman.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:153
verses.text: Canon LII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:154
verses.text: If any bishop or presbyter, does not receive him who turns away from his sin, but rejects him, let him be deposed; for he grieveth Christ who said, "There is joy in heaven over one sinner that repenteth".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:155
verses.text: Canon LIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:156
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, does not on festival days partake of flesh and wine, from an abhorrence of them, and not out of religious restraint, let him be deposed, as being seared in his own conscience, and being the cause of offence to many.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:157
verses.text: Canon LIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:158
verses.text: If any of the clergy be found eating in a tavern, let him be excommunicated, unless he has been constrained by necessity, on a journey, to lodge in an inn.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:159
verses.text: Canon LV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:160
verses.text: If any of the clergy insult the bishop, let him be deposed: for "thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:161
verses.text: Canon LVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:162
verses.text: If any of the clergy insult a presbyter, or deacon, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:163
verses.text: Canon LVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:164
verses.text: If any of the clergy mock the lame, or the deaf, or the blind, or him who is infirm in his legs, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:165
verses.text: In like manner any of the laity.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:166
verses.text: Canon LVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:167
verses.text: If any bishop or presbyter neglects the clergy or the people, and does not instruct them in the way of godliness, let him be excommunicated, and if he persists in his negligence and idleness, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:168
verses.text: Canon LIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:169
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, when any of the clergy is in want, does not supply him with what he needs, let him be excommunicated; but if he persists, let him be deposed, as one who has killed his brother.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:170
verses.text: Canon LX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:171
verses.text: If any one reads publicly in the church the falsely inscribed books of impious men, as if they were holy Scripture, to the destruction of the people and clergy, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:172
verses.text: Canon LXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:173
verses.text: If any accusation be brought against a believer of fornication or adultery, or any forbidden action, and he be convicted, let him not be promoted to the clergy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:174
verses.text: Canon LXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:175
verses.text: If any of the clergy, through fear of men, whether Jew, heathen, or heretic, shall deny the name of Christ, let him be cast out.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:176
verses.text: If he deny the name of a clergyman, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:177
verses.text: If he repent, let him be received as a layman.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:178
verses.text: Canon LXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:179
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any one of the sacerdotal order, shall eat flesh, with the blood of the life thereof, or anything killed by beasts, or that dies of itself, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:180
verses.text: For the law has forbidden this.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:181
verses.text: If he be a layman, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:182
verses.text: Canon LXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:183
verses.text: If any clergyman or layman shall enter into a synagogue of Jews or heretics to pray, let the former be deposed and let the latter be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:184
verses.text: Canon LXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:185
verses.text: If any clergyman shall strike anyone in a contest, and kill him with one blow, let him be deposed for his violence.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:186
verses.text: If a layman do so, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:187
verses.text: Canon LXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:188
verses.text: If any of the clergy be found fasting on the Lord's day, or on the Sabbath, excepting the one only, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:189
verses.text: If a layman, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:190
verses.text: Canon LXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:191
verses.text: If anyone shall force and keep a virgin not espoused, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:192
verses.text: And he may not take any other, but must retain her whom he has chosen, though she be a poor person.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:193
verses.text: Canon LXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:194
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, shall receive from anyone a second ordination, let both the ordained and the ordainer be deposed; unless indeed it be proved that he had his ordination from heretics; for those who have been baptized or ordained by such persons cannot be either of the faithful or of the clergy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:195
verses.text: Canon LXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:196
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or reader, or singer, does not fast the holy Quadragesimal fast of Easter, or the fourth day, or the day of Preparation, let him be deposed, unless he be hindered by some bodily infirmity.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:197
verses.text: If he be a layman, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:198
verses.text: Canon LXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:199
verses.text: If any bishop, presbyter, or deacon, or any one of the list of clergy, keeps fast or festival with the Jews, or receives from them any of the gifts of their feasts, as unleavened bread, any such things, let him be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:200
verses.text: If he be a layman, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:201
verses.text: Canon LXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:202
verses.text: If any Christian brings oil into a temple of the heathen or into a synagogue of the Jews at their feast, or lights lamps, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:203
verses.text: Canon LXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:204
verses.text: If any clergyman or layman takes away wax or oil from the holy Church, let him be excommunicated, [and let him restore a fifth part more than he took.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:205
verses.text: ]  Canon LXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:206
verses.text: Let no one convert to his own use any vessel of gold or silver, or any veil which has been sanctified, for it is contrary to law; and if anyone be detected doing so, let him be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:207
verses.text: Canon LXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:208
verses.text: If any bishop has been accused of anything by men worthy of credit, he must be summoned by the bishops; and if he appears, and confesses, or is convicted, a suitable punishment must be inflicted upon him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:209
verses.text: But if when he is summoned he does not attend, let him be summoned a second time, two bishops being sent to him, for that purpose.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:210
verses.text: [If even then he will not attend, let him be summoned a third time, two bishops being again sent to him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:211
verses.text: ] But if even then he shall disregard the summons and not come, let the synod pronounce such sentence against him as appears right, that he may not seem to profit by avoiding judgment.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:212
verses.text: Canon LXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:213
verses.text: An heretic is not to be received as witness against a bishop, neither only one believer; for "in the mouth of two or three witnesses, every word shall be established".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:214
verses.text: Canon LXXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:215
verses.text: A bishop must not out of favour to a brother or a son, or any other relation, ordain whom he will to the episcopal dignity; for it is not right to make heirs of the bishopric, giving the things of God to human affections.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:216
verses.text: Neither is it fitting to subject the Church of God to heirs.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:217
verses.text: But if anyone shall do so let the ordination be void, and the ordainer himself be punished with excommunication.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:218
verses.text: Canon LXXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:219
verses.text: If any one be deprived of an eye, or lame of a leg, but in other respects be worthy of a bishopric, he may be ordained, for the defect of the body does not defile a man, but the pollution of the soul.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:220
verses.text: Canon LXXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:221
verses.text: But if a man be deaf or blind, he may not be made a bishop, not indeed as if he were thus defiled, but that the affairs of the Church may not be hindered.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:222
verses.text: Canon LXXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:223
verses.text: If anyone has a devil, let him not be made a clergyman, neither let him pray with the faithful; but if he be freed, let him be received into communion, and if he is worthy he may be ordained.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:224
verses.text: Canon LXXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:225
verses.text: It is not allowed that a man who has come over from an heathen life, and been baptized or who has been converted from an evil course of living, should be immediately made a bishop, for it is not right that he who has not been tried himself should be a teacher of others.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:226
verses.text: Unless indeed this be done upon a special manifestation of Divine grace in his favour.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:227
verses.text: Canon LXXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:228
verses.text: We have said that a bishop or presbyter must not give himself to the management of public affairs, but devote himself to ecclesiastical business.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:229
verses.text: Let him then be persuaded to do so, or let him be deposed, for no man can serve two masters, according to the Lord's declaration.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:230
verses.text: Canon LXXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:231
verses.text: We do not allow any servants to be promoted to the clergy without the consent of their masters, [to the troubling of their houses.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:232
verses.text: ] But if any servant should appear worthy of receiving an order, as our Onesimus appeared, and his masters agree and liberate him, and send him out of their house, he may be ordained.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:233
verses.text: Canon LXXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:234
verses.text: If a bishop, presbyter, or deacon, shall serve in the army, and wish to retain both the Roman magistracy and the priestly office, let him be deposed; for the things of Caesar belong to Caesar, and those of God to God.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:235
verses.text: Canon LXXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:236
verses.text: Whosoever shall insult the King, or a ruler, contrary to what is right, let him suffer punishment.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:237
verses.text: If he be a clergyman, let him be deposed; if a layman, excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:238
verses.text: Canon LXXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:239
verses.text: Let the following books be counted venerable and sacred by all of you, both clergy and Laity.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:240
verses.text: Of the Old Testament, five books of Moses, Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, Deuteronomy; of Joshua the Son of Nun, one; of the Judges, one; of Ruth, one; of the Kings, four; of the Chronicles of the book of the days, two; of Ezra, two; of Esther, one; [some texts read "of Judith, one";] of the Maccabees, three; of Job, one; of the Psalter, one; of Solomon, three, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:241
verses.text: : Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and the Song of Songs; of the Prophets, twelve; of Isaiah, one; of Jeremiah, one; of Ezekiel, one; of Daniel, one.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:242
verses.text: But besides these you are recommended to teach your young persons the Wisdom of the very learned Sirach.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:243
verses.text: Our own books, that is, those of the New Testament, are: the four Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John; fourteen Epistles of Paul; two Epistles of Peter; three of John; one of James, and one of Jude.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:244
verses.text: Two Epistles of Clemens, and the Constitutions of me Clemens, addressed to you Bishops, in eight books, which are not to be published to all on account of the mystical things in them.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:245
verses.text: And the Acts of us the Apostles.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:246
verses.text: I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:247
verses.text: The Letter of the Blessed Dionysius, the Archbishop of Alexandria to Basilides the Bishop who made Enquiries on Various Subjects, to which Dionysius made Answer in this Epistle, which Answers have been received as Canons.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:248
verses.text: Dionysius to my beloved son, and brother, and fellow minister in holy things, Basilides faithful to God, salutation in the Lord.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:249
verses.text: Note.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:250
verses.text: Dionysius, Johnson says, wrote in about a.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:251
verses.text: d.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:252
Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:253
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:254
verses.text: When the Paschal fast is to be broken depends on the precise hour of our Saviour's resurrection, and this was not certainly to be known from the Four Evangelists; therefore they who have not fasted the Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday before Easter, do no great thing if they fast the Friday and Saturday, and so till past three on Easter morning.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:255
verses.text: But they who have fasted the whole six days, are not to be blamed if they break their fast after midnight.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:256
verses.text: Some do not fast any of these days.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:257
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:258
verses.text: Menstruous women ought not to come to the Holy Table, or touch the Holy of Holies, nor to the churches, but pray elsewhere.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:259
verses.text: Note.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:260
verses.text: Balsamon notes how the canon educes the example of the woman who had had an issue of blood for twelve years and who therefore did not dare to touch the Lord, but only the "hem of his garment".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:261
verses.text: He also notes that the question proposed, was whether Christian women should be excluded from the church and need follow the example of the Hebrews, who "when the menstrual flux was upon them, sat in a solitary place by themselves and waited for seven days to pass, and their flux should be over".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:262
verses.text: The answer given is as above.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:263
verses.text: Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:264
verses.text: They that can contain and are aged ought to judge for themselves.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:265
verses.text: They have heard St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:266
verses.text: Paul say; that they should "for a time give themselves to prayer, and then come together again".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:267
verses.text: Note.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:268
verses.text: In this epitome Johnson has set forth the meaning of the canon, as understood by the Greek scholiasts, rather than translated and epitomized the canon itself.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:269
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:270
verses.text: They who have had involuntary nocturnal pollutions be at their own discretion [whether to communicate or not].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:271
verses.text: Note.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:272
verses.text: The Saint ends this canon with these words: "I have given opinion on the points about which you have consulted me, not as a doctor, but in all simplicity as it is suitable the relation between us should be.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:273
verses.text: And when you have examined, my most learned son, what I have written you will let me know what seems to you better or whether you agree with my opinions.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:274
verses.text: Farewell, dear son, may your ministry be in the peace of the Lord".

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:275
verses.text: II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:276
verses.text: The Canons of the Blessed Peter, Archbishop of Alexandria, and Martyr, which are found in his Sermon on Penitence.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:277
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:278
verses.text: The fourth Easter from the beginning of the persecution was now come; and orders, that they who did not fall till after they had endured severe torments, and have already been "Mourners" three years, after forty days' fast, are to be admitted to communion, although they have not been before received [to penance].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:279
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:280
verses.text: But if they endured imprisonment only, without torments, let a year be added to their former penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:281
verses.text: Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:282
verses.text: If they fell voluntarily, without torments or imprisonments, but are come to repentance, four years are added to their former penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:283
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:284
verses.text: The case of them who do not repent pronounced desperate.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:285
verses.text: Canon V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:286
verses.text: They that used evasion, and did not right down subscribe the abnegation, or with their own hands incense the idols, but sent a heathen to do it for them, are enjoined six months' penance, though they have been pardoned by some of the Confessors.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:287
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:288
verses.text: Slaves forced by their masters to incense idols, and doing it in their master's stead, are enjoined a year's penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:289
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:290
verses.text: The masters who forced them to it, are enjoined three years' penance, as being hypocrites, and as forcing their slaves to sacrifice.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:291
verses.text: Canon VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:292
verses.text: They who first fell, and afterwards recovered themselves, by professing themselves Christians, and endured torments, are forthwith admitted to communion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:293
verses.text: Canon IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:294
verses.text: That they who provoked the magistrates to persecute themselves and others are to be blamed, yet not to be denied communion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:295
verses.text: Canon X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:296
verses.text: That clergymen, who run themselves into persecution, and fell, though they did afterward recover themselves, and suffer torments, yet are not to be admitted to perform the sacred offices.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:297
verses.text: Canon XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:298
verses.text: That they who prayed for them who fell after long torments, be connived at, and we pray together with them, since they lament for what they have done, with anguish and mortification.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:299
verses.text: Canon XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:300
verses.text: That they who with money purchased their ease and freedom, are to be commended.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:301
verses.text: Canon XIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:302
verses.text: Nor should we accuse those who ran away, and left all, though others left behind might fare the worse for it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:303
verses.text: Canon XIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:304
verses.text: That they who endured tortures, and afterwards, when they were deprived of speech and motion, had their hands forced into the fire, to offer unholy sacrifice, be placed in the Liturgy [i-e:, in the diptychs] among the Confessors.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:305
verses.text: Canon XV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:306
verses.text: Wednesday is to be fasted, because then the Jews conspired to betray Jesus; Friday, because he then suffered for us.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:307
verses.text: We keep the Lord's Day as a day of joy, because then our Lord rose.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:308
verses.text: Our tradition is, not to kneel on that day.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:309
verses.text: III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:310
verses.text: The Canonical Epistle of St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:311
verses.text: Gregory, Archbishop of Neocaesarea, who is called Thaumaturgus, concerning Them that, During the Incursion of the Barbarians, Ate of Things Offered to Idols and Committed Certain Other Sins.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:312
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:313
verses.text: That they who have been taken captives by the barbarians, and have eaten with them, be not treated as persons that have eaten things offered to idols; especially because it is universally reported, that they do not sacrifice to idols; nor shall those women who have been ravished by them, be treated as guilty of fornication, unless they were before of lewd lives.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:314
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:315
verses.text: That those Christians who plundered their brethren during the invasion, be excommunicated, lest wrath come on the people, and especially on the presidents, who enquire not into these matters.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:316
verses.text: Canons III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:317
verses.text: , IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:318
Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:319
verses.text: The pretence of having found those goods, or that they themselves lost things of equal value, shall stand them in no stead, but that they be excluded from prayer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:320
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:321
verses.text: Against those who detain them prisoners who had escaped from the barbarians, the holy man expects that such should be thunder-struck, and therefore desires that some enquiry be made upon the spot by persons sent for this purpose.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:322
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:323
verses.text: That they who joined the barbarians in their murder and ravages, or were guides or informers to them, be not permitted to be hearers, till holy men assembled together do agree in common upon what shall seem good, first to the Holy Ghost, then to themselves.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:324
verses.text: Canon VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:325
verses.text: But if they discover themselves, and make restitution, they shall be admitted to be Prostrators.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:326
verses.text: Canon IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:327
verses.text: They that are convicted to have found (though in their own houses) anything [of their neighbours'] left by the barbarians shall also be Prostrators; but if they shall confess themselves they shall communicate in prayer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:328
verses.text: Canon X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:356
verses.text: For there are in all twenty-two books of the Old Testament.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:357
verses.text: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, Deuteronomy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:358
verses.text: After this comes Joshua, and Judges, and Ruth.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:359
verses.text: The four books of the Kings, counted as two.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:360

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:361
verses.text: Then First and Second Esdras [i-e: Ezra and Nehemiah].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:362
verses.text: After these Psalms, Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and Cantica.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:363

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:364
verses.text: Then Isaiah, Jeremiah together with the Epistle of Baruch, the Lamentations, Ezekiel, and Daniel.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:365
verses.text: Of the New Testament these are the books [then follows the complete list ending with "the Apocalypse of John"].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:366
verses.text: These are the fountains of salvation, that whoso thirsteth, may be satisfied by the eloquence which is in them.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:367
verses.text: In them alone (  ) is set forth the doctrine of piety.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:368

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:369
verses.text: I also add for further accuracy that there are certain other books, not edited in the Canon, but established by the Fathers, to be read by those who have just come to us and wish to be instructed in the doctrine of piety.

verses.text: )  It has been determined by synods in Greece, Spain, France, that they who have fallen, or been leaders of impiety [Arianism], be pardoned upon repentance, but that they have not the place of the clergy; but that they who were only drawn away by force, or that complied for fear the people should be corrupted, have the place of the clergy too.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:383
verses.text: Let the people who have been deceived, or forced, be pardoned, upon repentance and pronouncing anathema against the miscreancy of Eudoxius and Euzoius, ringleaders of the Arians (who assert that Christ is a creature); and upon professing the faith of the Fathers at Nice, and that no synod can prejudice that.

verses.text: )  Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:391
verses.text: As to the question concerning the Puritans the custom of every country is to be observed, since they who have discussed this point are of various sentiments.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:392
verses.text: The [baptism] of the Pepuzenes I make no account of, and I wonder that Dionysius the canonist was of another mind.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:393
verses.text: The ancients speak of heresies, which entirely break men off, and make them aliens from the faith.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:394
verses.text: Such are the Manichaeans, Valentinians, Marcionites and Pepuzenes, who sin against the Holy Ghost, who baptize into the Father, Son and Montanus, or Priscilla.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:395
verses.text: Schisms are caused by ecclesiastical disputes, and for causes that are not incurable, and for differences concerning penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:396
verses.text: The Puritans are such schismatics.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:397
verses.text: The ancients, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:398
verses.text: Cyprian and Fermilian, put these, and the Encratites, and Hydroparastatae, and Apotactites, under the same condemnation; because they have no longer the communication of the Holy Ghost, who have broken the succession.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:399
verses.text: They who first made the departure had the spiritual gift; but by being schismatics, they became laymen; and therefore they ordered those that were baptized by them, and came over to the Church, to be purged by the true baptism, as those that are baptized by laymen.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:400
verses.text: Because some in Asia have otherwise determined, let [their baptism] be allowed: but not that of the Encratites; for they have altered their baptism, to make themselves incapable of being received by the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:401
verses.text: Yet custom and the Fathers, that is bishops, who have the administration, must be followed; for I am afraid of putting an impediment to the saved; while I would raise fears in them concerning their baptism.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:402
verses.text: We are not to allow their baptism, because they allow ours, but strictly to observe the canons.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:403
verses.text: But let none be received without unction.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:404
verses.text: When we received Zois and Saturninus to the Episcopal chair, we made, as it were, a canon to receive those in communion with them.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:405
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:406
verses.text: Let her that procures abortion undergo ten years' penance, whether the embryo were perfectly formed, or not.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:407
verses.text: Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:408
verses.text: A deacon guilty of fornication, is deposed, not excommunicated; for the ancient canon forbids a single crime to be twice punished.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:409
verses.text: And further, a layman excommunicated may be restored to the degree from which he falls, but a clergyman deposed cannot.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:410
verses.text: Yet it is better to cure men of their sins by mortification, and to execute the canon only in cases where we cannot reach what is more perfect.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:411
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:412
verses.text: They that marry a second time, used to be under penance a year or two.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:413
verses.text: They that marry a third time, three or four years.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:414
verses.text: But we have a custom, that he who marries a third time be under penance five years, not by canon, but tradition.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:415
verses.text: Half of this time they are to be hearers, afterwards Co-standers; but to abstain from the communion of the Good Thing, when they have shewed some fruit of repentance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:416
verses.text: Canon V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:417
verses.text: Heretics, upon their death-bed, giving good signs of their conversion, to be received.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:418
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:419
verses.text: Let it not be counted a marriage, when one belonging to the canon commits fornication, but let them be forced to part.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:420
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:421
verses.text: They who have committed sodomy with men or brutes, murderers, wizards, adulterers, and idolaters, have been thought worthy of the same punishment; therefore observe the same method with these which you do with others.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:422
verses.text: We ought not to make any doubt of receiving those who have repented thirty years for the uncleanness which they committed through ignorance; for their ignorance pleads their pardon, and their willingness in confessing it; therefore command them to be forthwith received, especially if they have tears to prevail on your tenderness, and have [since their lapse] led such a life as to deserve your compassion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:423
verses.text: Canon VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:424
verses.text: He that kills another with a sword, or hurls an axe at his own wife and kills her, is guilty of wilful murder; not he who throws a stone at a dog, and undesignedly kills a man, or who corrects one with a rod, or scourge, in order to reform him, or who kills a man in his own defence, when he only designed to hurt him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:425
verses.text: But the man, or woman, is a murderer that gives a philtrum, if the man that takes it die upon it; so are they who take medicines to procure abortion; and so are they who kill on the highway, and rapparees.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:426
verses.text: Canon IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:427
verses.text: Our Lord is equal, to the man and woman forbidding divorce, save in case of fornication; but custom requires women to retain their husbands, though they be guilty of fornication.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:428
verses.text: The man deserted by his wife may take another, and though he were deserted for adultery, yet St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:429
verses.text: Basil will be positive, that the other woman who afterward takes him is guilty of adultery; but the wife is not allowed this liberty.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:430
verses.text: And the man who deserts an innocent wife is not allowed to marry.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:431
verses.text: Canon X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:432
verses.text: That they who swear that they will not be ordained, be not forced to break their oath.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:433
verses.text: Severus, Bishop of Masada, who had ordained Cyriacus priest to a country church, subject to the Bishop of Mesthia, is referred to the divine tribunal, upon his pretending that he did it by surprise.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:434
verses.text: Cyriacus had upon his ordination, been forced, contrary to canon, to swear that he would continue in that country church; but the Bishop of Mesthia, to whom that church properly belonged, forced him out.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:435
verses.text: St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:436
verses.text: Basil advises Amphilochius to lay the country church to Masada, and make it subject to Severus, and to permit Cyriacus to return to it and save his oath; and by this means he supposes that Longinus, the lord of that country, would be prevailed upon to alter his resolution of laying that church desolate, as he declared he would upon Cyriacus's expulsion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:437
verses.text: Canon XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:438
verses.text: He that is guilty of involuntary murder, shall do eleven years' penancethat is, if the murdered person, after he had here received the wound, do again go abroad, and yet afterward die of the wound.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:439
verses.text: Canon XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:440
verses.text: The canon excludes from the ministry those who are guilty of digamy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:441
verses.text: Canon XIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:442
verses.text: Our fathers did not think that killing in war was murder; yet I think it advisable for such as have been guilty of it to forbear communion three years.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:443
verses.text: Canon XIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:444
verses.text: An usurer, giving his unjust gain to the poor, and renouncing his love of money, may be admitted into the clergy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:445
verses.text: Canons XV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:446
verses.text: and XVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:447
verses.text: Not properly canons, but explications of Scripture, and therefore neither Balsamon, nor Aristenus, regard them as canons.

verses.text: The Second Canonical Epistle of the Same.

verses.text: (This is found translated in the same volume last referred to, Epistle cxcix.
