verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:453
verses.text: I made a canon, that they at Antioch, who had sworn not to perform the sacred offices should not do it publicly, but in private only: As to Bianor, he is removed from thence to Iconium, and therefore is more at liberty; but let him repent of his rash oath which he made to an infidel for avoiding a small danger.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:454
verses.text: Canon XVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:455
verses.text: That the ancients received a professed virgin that had married, as one guilty of digamy, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:456
verses.text: , upon one year's penance; but they ought to be dealt with more severely than widows professing continency, and even as adulterers: But they ought not to be admitted to profess virginity till they are above sixteen or seventeen years of age, after trial, and at their own earnest request; whereas relations often offer them that are under age, for their own secular ends, but such ought not easily to be admitted.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:457
verses.text: Canon XIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:458
verses.text: That men, though they seem tacitly to promise celibacy, by becoming monks, yet do it not expressly; yet I think fit that they be interrogated too, and that a profession should be demanded of them, that if they betake themselves to a carnal life, they may be punished as fornicators.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:459
verses.text: Canon XX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:460
verses.text: Women professing virginity, though they did marry while they were heretics, or catechumens, yet are pardoned by baptism.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:461
verses.text: What is done by persons in the state of catechumens, is never laid to their charge.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:462
verses.text: Canon XXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:463
verses.text: A married man committing lewdness with a single woman, is severely punished as guilty of fornication, but we have no canon to treat such a man as an adulterer; but the wife must co-habit with such a one: But if the wife be lewd, she is divorced, and he that retains her is [thought] impious; such is the custom, but the reason of it does not appear.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:464
verses.text: Canon XXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:465
verses.text: That they who have stolen virgins, and will not restore them, be treated as fornicators; that they be one year mourners, the second hearers, the third received to repentance and the fourth be co-standers, and then admitted to communion of the Good Thing.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:466
verses.text: If the virgins be restored to those who had espoused them, it is at their discretion to marry them, or not; if to their guardians, it is at their discretion to give them in marriage to the raptors, or not.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:467
verses.text: Canon XXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:468
verses.text: That a man ought not to marry two sisters, nor a woman two brothers: That he who marries his brother's wife, be not admitted till he dismiss her.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:469
verses.text: Canon XXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:470
verses.text: A widow put into the catalogue of widows, that is, a deaconess being sixty years old, and marrying, is not to be admitted to communion of the Good Thing, till she cease from her uncleanness; but to a widower that marries no penance is appointed, but that of digamy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:471
verses.text: If the widow be less than sixty, it is the bishop's fault who admitted her deaconess, not the woman's.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:472
verses.text: Canon XXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:473
verses.text: He that marries a woman that he has corrupted, shall be under penance for corrupting her, but may retain her for his wife.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:474
verses.text: Canon XXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:475
verses.text: Fornication is neither marriage, nor the beginning of marriage.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:476
verses.text: If it may be, it is better that they who have committed fornication together be parted; but if they be passionate lovers, let them not separate, for fear of what is worse.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:477
verses.text: Canon XXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:478
verses.text: As for the priest that is engaged, through ignorance, in an unlawful marriage, I have decreed, that he retain the honour of the chair; but forbear all sacred operations, and not give the blessing either in private, or public, nor distribute the Body of Christ to another, nor perform any liturgy; but let him bewail himself to the Lord, and to men, that his sin of ignorance may be pardoned.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:479
verses.text: Canon XXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:480
verses.text: That it is ridiculous to vow not to eat swine's flesh, and to abstain from it is not necessary.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:481
verses.text: Canon XXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:482
verses.text: That princes ought not to swear to wrong their subjects: that such rash oaths ought to be repented of, and evil not to be justified under pretence of religion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:483
verses.text: Canon XXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:484
verses.text: That they who steal women, and their accomplices, be not admitted to prayers, or be co-standers for three years.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:485
verses.text: Where no violence is used, there no crime is committed, except there be lewdness in the case.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:486
verses.text: A widow is at her own discretion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:487
verses.text: We must not mind vain pretences.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:488
verses.text: Canon XXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:489
verses.text: She, whose husband is absent from home, if she co-habits with another man, before she is persuaded of his death, commits adultery.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:490
verses.text: Canon XXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:491
verses.text: The clergyman who is deposed for mortal sin, shall not be excommunicated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:492
verses.text: Canon XXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:493
verses.text: That a woman being delivered of a child in a journey, and taking no care of it, shall be reputed guilty of murder.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:494
verses.text: Canon XXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:495
verses.text: That the crime of women under penance for adultery, upon their own confession, or otherwise convicted, be not published, lest it occasion their death; but that they remain out of communion the appointed time.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:496
verses.text: Canon XXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:497
verses.text: If a woman leave her husband, and if it do upon inquiry appear, that she did it without reason, she deserves to be punished; but let him continue in communion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:498
verses.text: Canon XXXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:499
verses.text: A soldier's wife marrying after the long absence of her husband, but before she is certified of his death, is more pardonable than another woman, because it is more credible that he may be dead.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:500
verses.text: Canon XXXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:501
verses.text: That he, who having another man's wife or spouse taken away from him, marries another, is guilty of adultery with the first, not with the second.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:502
verses.text: Canon XXXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:503
verses.text: If a woman run after him that has corrupted her, she shall be under penance three years, though the parents be reconciled to her.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:504
verses.text: Canon XXXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:505
verses.text: She, who continues to live with an adulterer, is all that time an adulteress.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:506
verses.text: Canon XL.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:507
verses.text: She that [being a slave] gives herself up to the will of a man, without the consent of her master, commits fornication; for pacts of those who are under the power of others are null.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:508
verses.text: Canon XLI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:509
verses.text: A widow being at her own discretion, may marry to whom she will.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:510
verses.text: Canon XLII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:511
verses.text: Slaves marrying without the consent of their masters, or children without consent of their fathers, it is not matrimony but fornication, till they ratify it by consenting.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:512
verses.text: Canon XLIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:513
verses.text: That he who gives a mortal wound to another is a murderer, whether he were the first aggressor, or did it in his own defence.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:514
verses.text: Canon XLIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:515
verses.text: The deaconess that has committed lewdness with a pagan is not to be received to communion, but shall be admitted to the oblation, in the seventh yearthat is, if she live in chastity.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:516
verses.text: The pagan, who after [he has professed] the faith, betakes himself again to sacrilege, returns [like the dog] to his vomit: we therefore do not permit the sacred body of a deaconess to be carnally used.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:517
verses.text: Canon XLV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:518
verses.text: He that assumes the name of a Christian, but reproaches Christ, shall have no advantage from his name.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:519
verses.text: Canon XLVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:520
verses.text: She that marries a man who was deserted for a while by his wife, but is afterward dismissed upon the return of the man's former wife, commits fornication, but ignorantly: she shall not be prohibited marriage, but it is better that she do not marry.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:521
verses.text: Canon XLVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:522
verses.text: Encratites, Saccophorians, and Apotactites, are in the same case with the Novatians.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:523
verses.text: We re-baptize them all.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:524
verses.text: There is a diversity in the canons relating to the Novatians, no canon concerning the other.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:525
verses.text: If it be forbid with you, as it is at Rome for prudential causes, yet let reason prevail.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:526
verses.text: They are a branch of the Marcionists; and though they baptize in the name of the three divine Persons, yet they make God the author of evil, and assert, that wine and the creatures of God, are defiled.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:527
verses.text: The bishops ought to meet, and so to explain the canon, that he who does [baptize such heretics] may be out of danger, and that one may have a positive answer to give to those that ask it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:528
verses.text: Canon XLVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:529
verses.text: A woman dismissed from her husband, ought to remain unmarried, in my judgment.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:530
verses.text: Canon XLIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:531
verses.text: If a slave be forced by her master, she is innocent.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:532
verses.text: Canon L.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:533
verses.text: We look on third marriages as disgraceful to the Church, but do not absolutely condemn them, as being better than a vague fornication.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:534
verses.text: The Third Epistle of the Same to the Same.

verses.text: (Found in lib.

verses.text: cit.

Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:538
verses.text: 255, et seqq.

verses.text: Epistle ccxvij.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:540
verses.text: )  Canon LI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:541
verses.text: That one punishment be inflicted on lapsing clergymen, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:542
verses.text: : deposition, whether they be in dignity, or in the ministry which is given without imposition of hands.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:543
verses.text: Canon LII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:544
verses.text: A woman delivered in the road, and neglecting her child, is guilty of murder, unless she was under necessity by reason of the solitude of the place, and the want of necessaries.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:545
verses.text: Canon LIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:546
verses.text: A widow slave desiring to be married a second time, has, perhaps, been guilty of no great crime in pretending that she was ravished; not her pretence, but voluntary choice is to be condemned; but it is clear, that the punishment of digamy is due to her.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:547
verses.text: Canon LIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:548
verses.text: That it is in the bishop's power to increase or lessen penance for involuntary murder.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:549
verses.text: Canon LV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:550
verses.text: They that are not ecclesiastics setting upon highwaymen, are repelled from the communion of the Good Thing; clergymen are deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:551
verses.text: Canon LVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:552
verses.text: He that wilfully commits murder, and afterwards repents, shall for twenty years remain without communicating of the Holy Sacrament.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:553
verses.text: Four years he must mourn without the door of the oratory, and beg of the communicants that go in, that prayer be offered for him; then for five years he shall be admitted among the hearers, for seven years among the prostrators; for four years he shall be a co-stander with the communicants, but shall not partake of the oblation; when these years are completed, he shall partake of the Holy Sacrament.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:554
verses.text: Canon LVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:555
verses.text: The involuntary murderer for two years shall be a mourner, for three years a hearer, four years a prostrator, one year a co-stander, and then communicate.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:556
verses.text: Canon LVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:557
verses.text: The adulterer shall be four years a mourner, five a hearer, four a prostrator, two a co-stander.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:558
verses.text: Canon LIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:559
verses.text: The fornicator shall be a mourner two years, two a hearer, two a prostrator, one a co-stander.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:560
verses.text: Canon LX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:561
verses.text: Professed virgins and monks, if they fall from their profession, shall undergo the penance of adulterers.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:562
verses.text: Canon LXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:563
verses.text: The thief, if he discover himself, shall do one year's penance; if he be discovered [by others] two; half the time he shall be a prostrator, the other half a co-stander.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:564
verses.text: Canon LXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:565
verses.text: He that abuses himself with mankind, shall do the penance of an adulterer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:566
verses.text: Canon LXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:567
verses.text: And so shall he who abuses himself with beasts, if they voluntarily confess it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:568
verses.text: Canon LXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:569
verses.text: The perjured person shall be a mourner two years, a hearer three, a prostrator four, a co-stander one.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:570
verses.text: Canon LXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:571
verses.text: He that confesses conjuration, or pharmacy, shall do penance as long as a murderer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:572
verses.text: Canon LXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:573
verses.text: He that digs the dead out of their graves, shall be a mourner two years, a hearer three years, a prostrator four years, a co-stander one year.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:574
verses.text: Canon LXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:575
verses.text: Incest with a sister is punished as murder.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:576
verses.text: Canon LXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:577
verses.text: All incestuous conjunction, as adultery.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:578
verses.text: Canon LXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:579
verses.text: A reader or minister lying with a woman he has only espoused, shall cease from his function one year; but if he have not espoused her, he shall [wholly] cease from his ministry.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:580
verses.text: Canon LXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:581
verses.text: The priest or deacon that is polluted in lips, shall be made to cease from his function, but shall communicate with the priests or deacons.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:582
verses.text: He that does more shall be deposed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:583
verses.text: Canon LXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:584
verses.text: He that is convicted to have been conscious to any of these crimes, but not discovered it, shall be treated as the principal.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:585
verses.text: Canon LXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:586
verses.text: He that gives himself to divination, shall be treated as a murderer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:587
verses.text: Canon LXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:588
verses.text: He that denied Christ, is to be communicated at the hour of death, if he confess it, and be a mourner till that time.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:589
verses.text: Canon LXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:590
verses.text: [The bishop] that has the power of binding and loosing, may lessen the time of penance, to an earnest penitent.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:591
verses.text: Canon LXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:592
verses.text: He that commits incest with a half-sister, shall be a mourner three years, a hearer three years, a co-stander two years.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:593
verses.text: Canon LXXVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:594
verses.text: And so shall he be who takes in marriage his son's wife.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:595
verses.text: Canon LXXVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:596
verses.text: He that divorces his wife, and marries another, is an adulterer; and according to the canons of the Fathers, he shall be a mourner one year, a hearer two years, a prostrator three years, a co-stander one year, if they repent with tears.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:597
verses.text: Canon LXXVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:598
verses.text: So shall he who successively marries two sisters.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:599
verses.text: Canon LXXIX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:600
verses.text: So shall he who madly loves his mother-in-law, or sister.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:601
verses.text: Canon LXXX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:602
verses.text: The Fathers say nothing of polygamy as being beastly, and a thing unagreeable to human nature.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:603
verses.text: To us it appears a greater sin than fornication: Let therefore such [as are guilty of it] be liable to the canons, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:604
verses.text: : after they have been mourners one yearlet them be prostrators three yearsand then be received,  Canon LXXXI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:605
verses.text: They who in the invasion of the barbarians have after long torments, eaten of magical things offered to idols, and have sworn heathen oaths, let them not be received for three years; for two years let them be hearers, for three years prostrators, so let them be received; but they who did it without force, let them be ejected three years, be hearers two years, prostrators three years, co-standers three years, so let them be admitted to communion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:606
verses.text: Canon LXXXII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:607
verses.text: They who by force have been driven to perjury, let them be admitted after six years; but if without force, let them be mourners two years, hearers two years, the fifth year prostrators, two years co-standers.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:608
verses.text: Canon LXXXIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:609
verses.text: They that follow heathenish customs, or bring men into their houses for the contriving pharmacies, or repelling them, shall be one year mourners, one year hearers, three years prostrators, one year co-standers.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:610
verses.text: Canon LXXXIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:611
verses.text: We do not judge altogether by the length of time, but by the circumstances of the penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:612
verses.text: If any will not be drawn from their carnal pleasures, and choose to serve them rather than the Lord, we have no communication with them.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:613
verses.text: Canon LXXXV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:614
verses.text: Let us take care that we do not perish with them; let us warn them by night and day, that we may deliver them out of the snare or however save ourselves from their condemnation.

verses.text: A letter to Gregory, an unmarried priest, charging him to dismiss a woman whom he kept, though he was 70 years of age, and declared himself free from all amorous affections; and St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:635

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:644
verses.text: A letter to his Village-bishop: he complains of the want of discipline of the multiplying of the clergy, and that without due examination and enquiry into their morals; that they had dropped the old custom, which was for the priests and deacons to recommend to the Village Bishop, who taking the testimonial, and giving notice of it to the [City] Bishop, did afterwards admit the minister into the sacerdotal list; that the number of the inferior clergy was unreasonably increased, especially in time of war, when men got into orders to avoid the press: he orders a list of the clergy in every village to be sent to him, and who admitted him, if any have been admitted into the inferior orders by priests, that they be looked on as laymen.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:645
verses.text: Let not who will, put his name into the list.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:646
verses.text: Re-examine those who are there, expel the unworthy, admit none without my consent for the future; if you do he shall be counted a layman.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:663
verses.text: He speaks of the written doctrine, and the unwritten tradition of the Apostles, and says, that both have the same efficacy as to religion.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:664
verses.text: The unwritten traditions which he mentions, are the signing those who hope in Christ with the Cross; praying toward the East, to denote, that we are in quest of Eden, that garden in the East from whence our first parents were ejected (as he afterwards explains it), the words of invocation at the consecration of the Bread of Eucharist, and the cup of eulogy; the benediction of the baptismal water, the chrism and of the baptized person; the trine immersion, and the renunciations made at baptism; all which the Fathers concealed from those who were not initiated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:665
verses.text: He says the dogmata were always kept secret, the Kerugmata published; he adds the tradition of standing at prayer on the first day of the week, and the whole Pentecost (that is, from Easter to Whitsunday), not only to denote our rising with Christ, but as a prefiguration of our expecting an eternal perfect day, for the enjoyment of which we erect ourselves; and lastly, the profession of our faith in Father, Son and Holy Ghost at baptism.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:666
verses.text: Canon XCIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:667
verses.text: He asserts the Doxology [in these words] "with the Holy Spirit," to be an unwritten, Apostolic tradition.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:668
verses.text: For this is a dogma full of authority, venerable for its antiquity.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:669
verses.text: From the Letter of Basil the Great to the Nicopolitans.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:670
verses.text: There is also in Tilius and Bishop Beveridge here inserted an epistle of St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:671
verses.text: Basil the Great to the Nicopolitans, comforting them under the loss of their church or oratory, and telling them, that they ought not to be concerned that they worship God in the open air, for that the eleven Apostles worshipped God in an upper room, where they were cooped up, while they that crucified Jesus performed their worship in a most famous Temple.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:672
verses.text: VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:673
verses.text: The Canonical Epistle of St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:674
verses.text: Gregory, Bishop of Nyssa, to St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:675
verses.text: Letous, Bishop of Melitene.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:676
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:677
verses.text: At Easter not only they who are transformed by the grace of the laver, i-e: baptism, but they who are penitents and converts, are to be brought to God, i-e: to the Communion: for Easter is that Catholic feast in which there is a resurrection from the fall of sin.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:678
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:679
verses.text: They who lapse without any force, so as to deny Christ, or do by choice turn Jews, idolaters, or Manichees, or infidels of any sort, not to be admitted to communion till the hour of death; and if they chance to recover beyond expectation, to return to their penance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:680
verses.text: But they who were forced by torments, to do the penance of fornication.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:681
verses.text: Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:682
verses.text: If they who run to conjurers or diviners, do it through unbelief, they shall be treated as they who wilfully lapse, but if through want of sense, and through a vain hope of being relieved under their necessities, they shall be treated as those who lapse through the violence of torment.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:683
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:684
verses.text: That fornicators be three years wholly ejected from prayer, three years hearers, three years prostrators, and then admitted to communion; but the time of hearing and prostrating may be lessened to them who of their own accord confess, and are earnest penitents.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:685
verses.text: That this time be doubled in case of adultery, and unlawful lusts, but discretion to be used.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:686
verses.text: Canon V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:687
verses.text: Voluntary murderers shall be nine years ejected out of the church, nine years hearers, nine years prostrators; but every one of these nine years may be reduced to seven or six, or even five, if the penitents be very diligent.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:688
verses.text: Involuntary murderers to be treated as fornicators, but still with discretion, and allowing the communion on a death-bed, but on condition, that they return to penance if they survive.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:689
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:690
verses.text: That the Fathers have been too gentle toward the idolatry of covetous persons, in condemning to penance only robbery, digging of graves, and sacrilege, whereas usury and oppression, though under colour of contract, are forbidden by Scripture.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:691
verses.text: That highwaymen returning to the Church, be treated as murderers.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:692
verses.text: They that pilfer, and then confess their sin to the priest, are only obliged to amendment, and to be liberal to the poor; and if they have nothing, to labour and give their earnings.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:693
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:694
verses.text: They who dig into graves, and rake into the ashes and bones of the dead, in order to find some valuable thing buried together with the corpse, (not they who only take some stones belonging to a sepulchre, in order to use them in building) to do the penance of fornicators.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:695
verses.text: Canon VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:696
verses.text: He observes that by the law of Moses, sacrilege was punished as murder, and that the guilty person was stoned to death, and thinks the Fathers too gentle, in imposing a shorter penance on sacrilege than adultery.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:697
verses.text: VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:698
verses.text: From the Metre Poems of St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:699
verses.text: Gregory Theologus, Specifying which Books of the Old and New Testament Should Be Read.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:700
verses.text: Let not other books seduce your mind: for many malignant writings have been disseminated.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:701
verses.text: The historical books are twelve in number by the Hebrew count, [then follow the names of the books of the Old Testament but Esther is omitted, one Esdras, and all the Deutero-Canonical books].

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:702
verses.text: Thus there are twenty-two books of the Old Testament which correspond to the Hebrew letters.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:703
verses.text: The number of the books of the New Mystery are Matthew, who wrote the Miracles of Christ for the Hebrews; Mark for Italy; Luke, for Greece; John, the enterer of heaven, was a preacher to all, then the Acts, the xiv.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:704
verses.text: Epistles of Paul, the vii.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:705
verses.text: Catholic Epistles, and so you have all the books.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:706
verses.text: If there is any beside these, do not repute it genuine.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:707
verses.text: VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:708
verses.text: From the Iambics of St.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:709
verses.text: Amphilochius the Bishop to Seleucus, on the Same Subject.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:710
verses.text: We should know that not every book which is called Scripture is to be received as a safe guide.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:711
verses.text: For some are tolerably sound and others are more than doubtful.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:712
verses.text: Therefore the books which the inspiration of God hath given I will enumerate.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:713
verses.text: [Then follows a list of the proto-canonical books of the Old Testament, Esther alone being omitted.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:714
verses.text: All the deutero-canonical books are omitted.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:715
verses.text: He then continues] to these some add Esther.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:716
verses.text: I must now show what are the books of the New Testament.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:717
verses.text: [Then follow all the books of the New Testament except the Revelation.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:718
verses.text: He continues,] But some add to these the Revelation of John, but by far the majority say that it is spurious.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:719
verses.text: This is the most true canon of the divinely given Scriptures.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:720
verses.text: Note.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:721
verses.text: We have thus four [five if we accept the Laodicean list as genuine,] different canons of Holy Scripture, all having the approval of the Council in Trullo and of the Seventh Ecumenical.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:722
verses.text: From this there seems but one conclusion possible, viz.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:723
verses.text: : that the approval given was not specific but general.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:724
verses.text: IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:725
verses.text: The Canonical Answers of Timothy the Most Holy Bishop of Alexandria, Who was One of the CL Fathers Gathered Together at Constantinople, to the Questions Proposed to Him concerning Bishops and Clerics.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:726
verses.text: Question I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:727
verses.text: If a lad of seven years old, or a man, being a catechumen, being present at the oblation, does eat of it through ignorance, what shall be done in this case?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:728
verses.text: Let him be illuminated, i-e: baptized, for he is called by God.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:729
verses.text: Question II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:730
verses.text: If baptism be desired for a catechumen that is possessed, what shall be done?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:731
verses.text: Let him be baptized at the hour of death, not otherwise.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:732
verses.text: Question III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:733
verses.text: Ought a communicant to communicate, if he be possessed?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:734
verses.text: If he do not expose or blaspheme the Mysteries, let him communicate not always, but at certain times.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:735
verses.text: Question IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:736
verses.text: If a catechumen be sick, and in a frenzy, so that he cannot make profession of his faith, can he be baptized, at the entreaty of his friends?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:737
verses.text: He may, if he be not possessed.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:738
verses.text: Question V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:739
verses.text: Can a man or woman communicate after performing the conjugal act over night?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:740
verses.text: No.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:741
verses.text: 1 Cor.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:742
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:743
Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:744
verses.text: Question VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:745
verses.text: The day appointed for the baptism of a woman; on that day it happened that the custom of women was upon her; ought she then to be baptized?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:746
verses.text: No, not till she be clean.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:747
verses.text: Question VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:748
verses.text: Can a menstruous woman communicate?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:749
verses.text: Not until she be clean.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:750
verses.text: Question VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:751
verses.text: Ought a woman in child-bed to keep the Paschal fast?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:752
verses.text: No.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:753
verses.text: Question IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:754
verses.text: Ought a clergyman to perform the oblation, or pray, while an Arian or heretic is present?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:755
verses.text: As to the divine oblation, the deacon, after the kiss, makes a proclamation, "Let all that are not Communicants walk off;" therefore such persons ought not to be present, except they promise to repent, and renounce their heresy.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:756
verses.text: Question X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:757
verses.text: Is a sick man obliged to keep the Paschal fast?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:758
verses.text: No.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:759
verses.text: Question XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:760
verses.text: If a clergyman be called to celebrate a marriage, and have heard that it is incestuous; ought he to comply, and perform the oblation?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:761
verses.text: No; he must not be partaker of other men's sins.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:762
verses.text: Question XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:763
verses.text: If a layman ask a clergyman whether he may communicate after a nocturnal pollution?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:764
verses.text: If it proceed from the desire of a woman, he ought not: but if it be a temptation from Satan, he ought; for the tempter will ply him when he is to communicate.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:765
verses.text: Question XIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:766
verses.text: When are man and wife to forbear the conjugal act?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:767
verses.text: On Saturday, and the Lord's day; for on those days the spiritual sacrifice is offered.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:768
verses.text: Question XIV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:769
verses.text: Shall there be an oblation for him, who being distracted, murders himself?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:770
verses.text: Not except the case be very clear that he was distracted.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:771
verses.text: Question XV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:772
verses.text: If one's wife be possessed to such a degree, as that she be bound with irons, and the man cannot contain, may he marry another?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:773
verses.text: I can only say it would be adultery so to do.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:774
verses.text: Question XVI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:775
verses.text: If a man in washing or bathing, swallow a drop of water, may he communicate after it?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:776
verses.text: If Satan find an occasion of hindering us from the communion, he will the oftener do it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:777
verses.text: Question XVII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:778
verses.text: Are they, who hear the Word, and do it not, damned?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:779
verses.text: If we neither do it, or repent that we have not done it.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:780
verses.text: Question XVIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:781
verses.text: At what age are sins imputed to us by God?  Answer.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:782
verses.text: According to every one's capacity and understanding; to one at ten, to another when older.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:783
verses.text: X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:784
verses.text: The Prosphonesus of Theophilus, Archbishop of Alexandria, When the Holy Epiphanies Happened to Fall on a Sunday.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:785
verses.text: Canon I.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:786
verses.text: Because the fast of Epiphany chances to fall on a Lord's day, let us take a few dates, and so break our fast, and honour the Lord's day, and shew our dislike of heresy, and yet not wholly neglect the fast which should be observed on this day; eating no more till our evening assembly at three afternoon.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:787
verses.text: The Commonitory of the Same which Ammon Received on Account of Lycus.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:788
verses.text: Canon II.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:789
verses.text: Let [the priests] who have communicated with the Arians, be retained or rejected, as the custom of every church is; but so, that other orthodox [priests] be ordained, though the others continue.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:790
verses.text: As the orthodox bishops did in Thebais, so let it be in other cities.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:791
verses.text: They who were ordained by Bishop Apollo, and afterwards communicated with the Arians, if they did it of their own accord, let them be censured; but if they only did it in obedience to the bishop, let them be continued; but if all the people abdicate them, others must be ordained.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:792
verses.text: And if Bistus the priest be found to have committed uncleanness with a woman dismissed from her husband, let him not be permitted to be a priest.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:793
verses.text: But this is no prejudice to the bishop who ordained him, if he did it ignorantly; since the Holy Synod commands unworthy men to be ejected, though they be not convicted until after ordination.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:794
verses.text: Canon III.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:795
verses.text: Let Bishop Apollo's sentence against his priest Sur prevail, though he has the liberty of being further heard.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:796
verses.text: Canon IV.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:797
verses.text: If Panuph the deacon married his brother's daughter before baptism, let him continue among the clergy, if she be dead, and he had not to do with her after his baptism; but if he married her, and cohabited with her while he was a communicant, let him be ejected from the clergy, without prejudice to the bishop who ordained him, if he did it ignorantly.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:798
verses.text: Canon V.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:799
verses.text: If it do evidently appear, that Jacob, while he was reader, did commit fornication, and was ejected by the priests (), and yet afterwards ordained, let him be ejected, and not otherwise.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:800
verses.text: Canon VI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:801
verses.text: That all in holy orders unanimously choose those who are to be ordained, and then the bishop examine [them]; or that the bishop ordain them in the midst of the church, all that are in holy orders consenting, and the bishop with a loud voice asking the people, who are then to be present, whether they can give their testimony [to the parties to be ordained]; and that ordination be not performed in private; if there be in the remote country, who while they were communicants [with the Arians] communicated in their opinions, let them not be ordained until they be examined by orthodox clergymen, in the presence of the bishop, who is to charge the people, that there be no running up and down in the middle of the church, or service.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:802
verses.text: Canon VII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:803
verses.text: Let the clergymen distribute all that is offered by way of sacrifice, after so much as was necessary has been consumed in the Mysteries.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:804
verses.text: Let not the catechumens taste of them, but clergymen and communicants only.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:805
verses.text: Canon VIII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:806
verses.text: One, Hierax, had delated a clergyman as guilty of fornication.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:807
verses.text: Bishop Apollo defended him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:808
verses.text: Theophilus orders the matter to be examined.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:809
verses.text: Canon IX.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:810
verses.text: That an oeconomus be created, by the consent of all that are in Holy Orders, with the concurrence of Bishop Apollo, that so the goods of the Church be expended as they ought.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:811
verses.text: Canon X.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:812
verses.text: That the widows, poor, and travellers be not disturbed; and that no one make a property of the goods of the Church.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:813
verses.text: Of the Same to Agatho the Bishop.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:814
verses.text: Whereas Maximus has for ten years lived in unlawful marriage, but pretends that it was through ignorance, and that they are now parted by mutual consent, let them stand among the catechumens, if it appear that they be in earnest.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:815
verses.text: Of the Same to Menas the Bishop.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:816
verses.text: Theophilus was informed, that the priest in Geminus, a village, had repelled Kyradium (a woman) from the communion: Theophilus approves of it, because she had done wrong, and was unwilling to make satisfaction; but orders her to be admitted to communion upon repentance.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:817
verses.text: The Narrative of the Same concerning Those Called Cathari.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:818
verses.text: Because the great synod held at Nice has decreed, That [the clergymen] who come over to the Church from the Novatians be ordained; do you ordain those that come over, if their life be upright, and there be no objection.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:819
verses.text: XI.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:820
verses.text: The Canonical Epistle of Our Holy Father Among the Saints, Cyril, Archbishop of Alexandria, on the Hymns.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:821
verses.text: Cyril to Domnus.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:822
verses.text: This letter contains a complaint of one, Peter, deposed from his See, yet retaining the character of a bishop, who thought his cause good, but complains that he had not time and opportunity given him for his defence; and that whatever he had, was taken away from him.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:823
verses.text: He desires Domnus, who was a Metropolitan, that he would call a synod, and let him have a hearing; and that such bishops as Peter suspected of prejudice against him should not be permitted to be his judges.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:824
verses.text: He thinks it very hard, that not only what belonged to the Church, but every thing else was taken from him; and complains that all bishops were called to account for every thing they received, whether from the Church, or by any other means.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:825
verses.text: Peter had indeed signed an instrument of resignation; but Cyril says, that he was terrified into it; and that he would have no such resignation be of force except he that made it deserved deposition.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:826
verses.text: Of the Same to the Bishops of Libya and Pentapolis.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:827
verses.text: There is another Epistle of the same father, complaining to the bishops of Libya and Pentapolis.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:828
verses.text: That some who had been refused ordination by their own bishop, or cast out of the monasteries for their irregularity, were ordained by a surprise upon some other bishop, and that just as they came from their bride-bed, and then went and performed the oblation, or any other office, in the monasteries from which they had been ejected, which gave great offence.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:829
verses.text: He charges the bishops to take care of this for the future and, if any were to be ordained, to enquire into their lives, and whether they are married, and when, and how; and orders, that catechumens, who had been separated for lapsing, be baptized at the hour of death.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:830
verses.text: XII.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:831
verses.text: The Encyclical Letter of Gennadius, Patriarch of Constantinople and of the Holy Synod Met with Him to All the Holy Metropolitans and to the Pope of the City of Rome.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:832
verses.text: To the most beloved of God, fellow-minister, Gennadius and the most holy synod assembled in the royal city which is New Rome, sendeth greeting.

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:833
verses.text: As our Lord without money and without price ordained his Apostles, so should we ordain the clergy, for the Lord has placed us in their grade and in their stead (      ).

verses.name: Canons of the Holy and Altogether August Apostles 1:834
verses.text: Nor should we use any ingenious sophisms to avoid this plain duty, explicitly laid upon us, not only by the words of the Gospel but also by a canon of the great Ecumenical Synod of Chalcedon.
